entries.title: Ninth severe storm batters California in ‘major disaster’
entries.description: Governor Gavin Newsom signs an executive order to help with relief efforts as state endures three weeks of storms.

entries.title: Elon Musk’s next drama: A trial over his tweets on Tesla
entries.description: Trial on Tesla boss Musk's old tweets that he had raised money to take the auto firm private is set to start on Tuesday.

entries.title: Venezuela’s teachers march for better pay amid soaring inflation
entries.description: Even as Venezuela's inflation reached an estimated 305 percent last year, gov't did not adjust employee salaries.

entries.title: Martin Luther King Jr Day renews push to tackle racial injustice
entries.description: US federal holiday honouring slain civil rights leader comes amid rising fears over hate crimes, curbs to voting access.

entries.title: Latvia urges Western allies to step up military aid for Ukraine
entries.description: Latvian President Egils Levits says Ukraine needs more support to resist a potential new Russian offensive.

entries.title: London court allows appeal over UK’s Rwanda asylum-seeker plan
entries.description: High Court says claimants can challenge its previous ruling that the British gov't plan was lawful.

entries.title: Is globalisation coming to an end?
entries.description: World leaders are gathering at the WEF in Davos to debate ways to revive the global economy.

entries.title: Will the West deliver the tanks Ukraine is asking for?
entries.description: Ukraine hopes German-made Leopard 2 battle tanks will become the backbone of a new fighting force.

entries.title: Brazil boosts security in capital as riot investigations progress
entries.description: Authorities are seeking to identify anyone who helped fund or organise the storming of government offices in Brasilia.

entries.title: Colombian police seize weapons in ‘important blow’ to armed group
entries.description: Arsenal of weapons, including M60 machine gun and grenades, belonged to FARC rebel dissidents, Colombian police say.

entries.title: Israelis are not demonstrating for democracy
entries.description: Democracy in Israel would mean an end to apartheid. That is not what the Israeli protesters want.

entries.title: No visitor logs from Biden home where classified files found: WH
entries.description: White House lawyers say Biden's 'personal residence is personal' after GOP demands more information about searches.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Dnipro reels as Russia, Belarus hold military drills
entries.description: One of the war's deadliest attacks rocks the central Ukrainian city as Russia denies responsibility.

entries.title: Somalia claims capture of key port town from al-Shabab
entries.description: The government and allied clan militias have forced the rebels from swathes of territory, in the latest offensive.

entries.title: Years after alarm was raised, UK police officer admits rape
entries.description: David Carrick admits to dozens of sexual offences over 18 years while in London's Metropolitan Police.

entries.title: African musicians converge in Senegal for annual awards ceremony
entries.description: The event was the eighth edition of AFRIMA and the first to be held in a French-speaking country.

entries.title: What you need to know about Nepal’s plane crash
entries.description: Dramatic video shot on phone from the ground showed last moments before crash of plane carrying 72 people.

entries.title: Lebanon blast relatives questioned by police after protest
entries.description: Family members of the victims of the 2020 Beirut port explosion were called in for questioning after recent protests.

entries.title: Israeli army kills a Palestinian boy in the occupied West Bank
entries.description: Omar Khmour, 14, was shot in the head by the Israeli army during a raid on Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank.

entries.title: Burkina Faso: 50 women abducted by suspected rebels
entries.description: Burkina Faso has been struggling to contain violence by armed groups with links to al-Qaeda and ISIL (ISIS) since 2015.

entries.title: German defence minister resigns after months of criticism
entries.description: Lambrecht has been blamed for failing to modernise the army and denounced over Berlin's response to the Ukraine war.

entries.title: What is Martin Luther King Jr Day and why is it celebrated?
entries.description: Al Jazeera takes a look at this federal holiday and what it means in the United States.

entries.title: I’m tired of Harry and Meghan. The media should be too
entries.description: They want to earn millions from the very media they’ve attacked, while news that matters gets ignored in the process.

entries.title: At least 19 dead after bus collides with truck in Senegal
entries.description: The accident comes eight days after another crash killed 40 people and injured more than 100.

entries.title: Firms in Europe, US helping Myanmar manufacture arms, report says
entries.description: Rights experts urge countries to take action against firms helping Myanmar's military produce weapons used in abuses.

entries.title: Photo: Nigeria’s female bouncers shatter stereotypes
entries.description: Dragon Squad Limited: Strong women bouncers who are honing skills, getting stronger and shattering stereotypes.

entries.title: Matteo Messina Denaro: Italian mafia boss arrested in Sicily
entries.description: Matteo Messina Denaro, a leader within Sicily's Cosa Nostra mafia, has been linked to a string of murders.

entries.title: Madame White Snake: An opera troupe fights eviction in Shanghai
entries.description: An opera singer fights to keep her community together when her theatre in Shanghai is slated for demolition.

entries.title: Dnipro devastated by one of Russia’s deadliest attacks
entries.description: The death toll from a missile strike on an apartment building in Dnipro has risen to 35.

entries.title: Who is – and who isn’t – attending the World Economic Forum?
entries.description: Some 2,700 leaders from 130 countries, including 52 heads of state and government, will be at the meeting in Davos.

entries.title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa skips WEF over Eskom power cuts
entries.description: Repeated power cuts have become common in South Africa in the last decade as state utility Eskom continues to struggle.

entries.title: Pakistan launches year’s first nationwide anti-polio campaign
entries.description: The three-day drive aims to immunise more than 44 million children under the age of five against the viral disease.

entries.title: Cargo ship from Ukraine grounded in Istanbul’s Bosphorus Strait
entries.description: Maritime traffic in the famous waterway has stalled after a freighter carrying peas runs aground.

entries.title: Jailed Iranian American starts hunger strike, appeals to Biden
entries.description: Siamak Namazi was arrested in October 2015 and charged with trying to overthrow the state, which he denies.

entries.title: Nick Kyrgios pulls out of Australian Open with knee injury
entries.description: The mercurial tennis star will miss his home Grand Slam due to a knee injury that requires surgery.

entries.title: Barcelona beat Real Madrid in Spanish Super Cup final
entries.description: Barcelona win their first title since former player Xavi took over as the team’s coach in 2021.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 327
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 327th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Chinese navy holds ‘confrontational drills’ in South China Sea
entries.description: Chinese drills came as the US Nimitz carrier group also conducted maritime strike training in the contested waterway.

entries.title: Two workers killed after clashes at Indonesian nickel smelter
entries.description: Police say an Indonesian and Chinese worker died following a labour protest at a smelter on Sulawesi island.

entries.title: Nepal looks for four people missing after deadly air crash
entries.description: Rescuers had recovered 68 bodies out of 72 people on board the Yeti Airlines plane that crashed in Pokhara on Sunday.

entries.title: Belarus, Russia to start ‘defensive in nature’ air force drills
entries.description: The military activity has raised concern that Moscow might use its neighbour to mount a new ground assault on Ukraine.

entries.title: Richest 1% bag two-thirds of $42 trillion in new wealth: Oxfam
entries.description: Charity calls for more taxes on the rich as World Economic Forum gathers for annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland.

entries.title: UK government to make it easier for police to stop protests
entries.description: UK Prime Minister says changes needed to stop disruption, but critics warn of risk to civil liberties.

entries.title: Malaysia’s tourism recovery flops as Thailand, Indonesia cash in
entries.description: Malaysia is struggling to bring back tourists compared with its Southeast Asian peers after scrapping pandemic curbs.
